text: everyone knows that apple pie is one of
those fall favorites we have a twist on
the original this is an apple bourbon
potpie so I'm going to combine about
four pounds of apples
I have Rome apples and Granny Smith big
chef's knife to cut through the apples
and first cut in quarters okay let me
use a paring knife to remove the core
divide these in half we want eighths so
every quarter gets cut in half I'm gonna
finish up my apples and then we'll
combine with all the great insides one
cup of granulated sugar over the top 3/4
teaspoon of coarse salt it's always good
to add salt to anything you're baking
really just to bring out flavors and
balance everything and 1/2 teaspoon of
allspice such a beautiful perfumey spice
grate with apples one lemon here I'm
going to juice I need two tablespoons of
juice it's always essential to add a
little bit of lemon keep them from
browning okay now this is going to the
stove we're gonna cook the filling
before it goes into the oven I'm gonna
do it half a batch of the time on high
heat get 3 tablespoons of butter to
start about half these apples with their
juices go in just want to start to
soften these so it's about 5 minutes on
high heat to really get them going and
then we'll turn it down
okay now that the juices are thickening
I'm going to turn it down to about
medium-high another five minutes these
apples look nice and soft so I'm gonna
take them out and add my second batch
okay have all my apples that have been
softened so now I get to add the good
part third of a cup of bourbon this is
gonna add some really nice kind of
vanilla notes to the apples and then a
little bit of thickener two tablespoons
of flour we'll just cook this just to
combine it get the flour activated about
one minute now we're ready to fill our
ramekins I have six ramekins these are
one cup capacity ramekins so we're just
going to divide this mixture okay now
for the top I have frozen defrosted puff
pastry so a little bit of flour on the
board and on top you don't have to roll
this much I'm just gonna even it out a
little bit I'm gonna cut this into six
pieces to top my six pot pies
okay on top now this will shrink up a
bit in the oven so don't worry about the
overhang I'm cutting a little steam vent
in the top that way the pastry will stay
nice and crisp and then egg wash this
will give a beautiful Sheen to the top
of the pastry and then they'll go into a
375-degree oven so the pastry is puffed
and the juices are bubbling takes about
25 minutes so our gorgeous little pot
pies are ready
they've been cooling for about five
minutes so ready to top with some
vanilla ice cream this is perfect
complement to any fall meal with family
and friends everyone is going to love
biting into one of these
you
you
